newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht steady late, interbank rate edges down.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht steady late, interbank rate edges down.

text.p: The Thai baht was trading near morning levels against the dollar in late dealings on Thursday following U.S. unit's narrow range of trading abroad, dealers said.
The baht was quoted at 26.075/26.080 to the dollar late compared with 26.075/26.078 earlier, dealers said.

"The market remained slow as it has been over the past few days," said one dealer at a foreign bank. "The (Thai) economic figures did not have much of a negative impact on the baht because foreign exchange reserves were still high."
The Bank of Thailand earlier announced several key economic indicators for March including foreign reserves which remained steady from February at $38.1 billion.
The Bank of Thailand fixed the mid-rate at 26.07 per dollar against 26.08 on Wednesday.
The overnight interbank rate eased slightly to 7.75-8.00 percent late from 8.00 percent in the morning on rising liquidity, dealers said.
